title: Find a Therapist | ANTA
cleaned_text: To ensure that our members are the best of the best, they must meet a strict set of guidelines. They need to hold an officially-recognised Australian qualification, and also complete a certain number of professional development hours each year to stay on top of their game. These guidelines allow us to filter out Australia's very best natural therapists, and it's also the reason why they are eligible for health fund recognition (allowing you to claim rebates). By choosing an ANTA therapist, you know that their skills and safety have already been validated by us, and that they are capable of delivering excellent natural health care. Things To Consider When Choosing A Natural Therapy Practitioner Whether the natural therapy practitioner is a member of a reputable association, with a public directory including the following: Confirmation of the practitioners association membership, and up-to-date accreditation certificates. A list of recognised courses for education/training A policy on professional indemnity insurance A code of professional ethics A formal complaints process Qualifications criteria Membership criteria It's natural to want the best health treatment. When selecting a natural therapy practitioner, look for the ANTA symbol. It's a guarantee of professionalism, and high-quality natural therapy treatment. Our members' primary concern is your health. Are You A Leading Health Professional? Natural therapies are largely governed by professional associations, making the choice of practitioner and their association's standards of entry of vital importance. At ANTA, we've been accrediting natural healthcare practitioners for more than 60 years, ensuring that they meet the high educational and training standards required for ANTA membership.
